Damn it, you're right - settings aren't always saving out to the persistent config file. I'll track down the problem and release another update later today.

In the meantime, you can edit the config file manually to make the settings stick. It's under GameData\PartCommander\PartCommander.cfg, and by default will look like this:

    Settings{    useStockToolbar = True    enableHotKey = True    hotKey = P    hideUnAct = False}

You can turn the options on and off by setting them to "True" or "False".
Thanks, manually setting them has worked ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Possible bug/unintended behavior:

Observed behavior:

IFF the Part Commander window is active AND the mouse is over the active craft/EVA, then keyboard input is ignored. It's as though the input-locking is happening not just for the Part Commander window but for the area over the craft as well.

Expected behavior:

Keyboard inputs (changing throttle, pitch/roll/yaw, etc) are ignored only when a text-input field is active.

Tested on KSP 1.0.4, Windows, 32-bit, no other mods installed.
